urls.title: COVID-19 in children and the role of school settings in transmission - second update
urls.description: The aim of this document is to provide an update on the knowledge surrounding the role of children in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and the role of schools in the COVID-19 pandemic, focusing in particular on the experience in EU/EEA countries since the beginning of the pandemic. This document also addresses transmission to and from staff in school settings, school-related mitigation measures including risk communication, testing, contact tracing, and the effectiveness and impacts of school closures.

tweets.text:
#JustPublished:
#COVID19 in children and the role of school settings in transmission - first update!

Our report on kids and COVID-19 has been updated based on most recent knowledge and.

@atobias69 @ECDC_Outbreaks Hi Aurelio, thanks for reaching out and for your feedback. ECDC switched to weekly reporting in order to shift epidemic intelligence resources from case counting to signal/event detection and analysis, which will include COVID-19 but also other potential threats. Stay safe!

@ojessen Hi Owe, thanks for your question! By switching to a weekly schedule, ECDC will shift its epidemic intelligence (EI) resources from case counting to signal/event detection & resume its regular EI activities, which will include COVID-19 analysis but also other potential threats.

@sTeamTraen Hi Nick, thanks for reaching out! 14 Dec was the last daily update. ECDC is switching to weekly reporting in order to shift epidemic intelligence (EI) resources from case counting to signal/event detection, which will include COVID-19 analysis but also other potential threats.

Today's update is the last daily update on the #COVID19 situation in the EU/EEA/UK and worldwide. ECDC will switch to a weekly reporting schedule starting this Thursday, 17 December.

There are lots of challenges with #COVID19 data. #Surveillance is the backbone of prevention and control of the infectious diseases.

Data you get depend on the system you design. Before you design the system you need to know what you want to do with the data.
#EHFG2020 https://t.co/DdCbW7nHGS

For winter we need to monitor other respiratory diseases, especially #influenza.

We need a proper protocol to get the data in the system – to set capable monitoring of #COVID19 and #flu. It is important to have it uniform in all MS to have informed political decisions.
#EHFG2020 https://t.co/AX4ok08QY4
